definition: to be outraged by an injustice
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
(negative prefix)/not/no
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]

sentences.english: He often bullies you. I really take up the cudgel for you.
sentences.chinese: 他常欺負你，我真爲你打抱不平。

sentences.english: All the heroes in "The Water Margin" are such valiants.
sentences.chinese: 《水滸傳》裏的英雄們都是愛“打抱不平”的好漢。

sentences.english: In my colleagues in the eyes, he Wai are cooling, good fight against the injustice.
sentences.chinese: 在同事眼中，他爲人熱情，好打抱不平。

sentences.english: Do you speak up – or remain silent.
sentences.chinese: 你會大聲說出來爲他打抱不平，還是沉默不語？

sentences.english: He always sticks up for the underdog.
sentences.chinese: 他總是替弱者打抱不平。

sentences.english: Otherwise you may be viewed as a chronic malcontent .
sentences.chinese: 否則，你可能會被看作是一種慢性抱不平。

sentences.english: I said I'm really sorry and I promised would defend them against the injustice.
sentences.chinese: 說起這個他們就很氣憤，我也挺爲他們打抱不平。

definition: to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
feel wronged
see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to complain bitterly
to cry out a grievance
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
to give vent to anger
